definition: to know the first, but not know the second (idiom); only partial information
pinyin: zhi3 zhi1 qi2 yi1 , bu4 zhi1 qi2 er4

definition: grain that has begun to ripen/variant of 衹|只[zhi3]
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
even the wisest can have a momentary lapse in judgment (idiom)/every man has a fool in his sleeve
pinyin: cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , hu2 tu5 yi1 shi2

definition: One who does not know is not guilty/If one does not know any better, one cannot be held responsible
not to understand the situation/unaware of the ins and outs
slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
If you want to condemn sb, don't worry about the pretext (idiom, from Zuozhuan 左傳|左传); one can always trump up a charge against sb/Give a dog a bad name, then hang him.
pinyin: yu4 jia1 zhi1 zui4 , he2 huan4 wu2 ci2

definition: slight knowledge of sth/to know very little about a subject/a smattering
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions/also written 振振有詞|振振有词
lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
